author: Tediousity
title: Not Too Shabby
review:
It's a nice fun pack. Not exceedingly fantastic, but you get what you ask for. Allow me to explain.

Figures

The one figure included in this set is (of course) Aquaman himself: Arthur Curry, king of the seas. He's nicely detailed, with his trademark orange-scale shirt, green gloves, golden belt, and green pants all included. This is the same version of Aquaman we've had in the past, so sorry, but nothing new there. However, this was my first time coming in contact with the figure and I really like it. One thing to note is that while the torso is fabulously detailed, there is no such printing on the legs and they are plain green, and though I dislike this, I really can't see how that could be avoided, as there's nothing else to put on there. I'd give Aquaman a 4.5/5 overall.

Parts

The main interesting parts of this pack (not including the bases) are the tridents. This set comes with two: one for Aquaman to hold and one for the engine of the "Aqua Watercraft". It also has two orange flippers and two in lime green. The last thing of note here is the transparent blue flame pieces, forming the jets of the watercraft. Overall, 3-4/5.

Build

The build...well, to be honest, I just guessed at it from the packaging and I think I got it pretty well, although there is a classic-looking laser gun piece that I have no idea where it fits. A fair bit of SNOT here and the flippers were cleverly used to bridge the distance between the clips on the sides and the main body. I'm giving this a 4/5.

In-Game Experience

As my copy of the base game is still shipping, I can't give very good information here. However, I know Aquaman has a useful skill set including Hazard Cleanup, Dive, and the unique Atlantis Pools ability, and I look forward to swimming around the Atlantis part of the DC open world with him.

Aquaman unlocks no new levels or adventure worlds, but due to the remaining content of the pack, I'll still have to recommend him--though not if you don't own the game and already own Aquaman.

author: Odeinoichus
title: The King of Atlantis in the Palm of your Hand.
review:
Set #71237 Aquaman Fun Pack: We’re nearing the end of Series 1, finally, and with this review we find another character which has a unique and necessary ability to solve puzzles and complete the game 100% for folks looking to complete their LEGO dimensions game. This set just so happens to be the second last DC Super Heroes based set for the entire Theme. (Teen Titans Go in Series 2 is also owned by DC, but doesn’t really count as DC Super Heroes since, to the best of my knowledge, they do not access the DC Adventure World.)

Packaging

Aquaman is predominant on the package, there are no city shots in the background either instead we find an underwater shot as he spews water out of his trident like a magical fire hose.

Parts

Orange and Green flippers are included in this set as well as a pair of tridents and regular orange and green elements you’d find most often in Creator System sets or Classic sets.

Minifigures

Aquaman: This Minifigure is not new, the print and detailing is the same as that found in DC Super Hero sets using the character who is not based on his DCEU film counterpart. He includes his unique toy tag and a trident accessory.

The build

Aqua Watercraft: This first model is built fairly nicely and almost matches up to the digital model found in-game. Some elements are used as cheats instead of unique parts, but other than that the model is built quickly and looks quite promising.

Seven Seas Speeder: This model represents a submarine build that is meant to resemble a crustacean if I’m not mistaken. The builds all evoke some kind of sea creature and look fairly interesting while relying on the same parts. This model is a closer match when built to the design seen in-game.

Trident of Fire: I feel this model might just be the best of the bunch. It’s simple, fun and very impressive as far as the build goes making an interesting and unique little micro-build submarine.

The completed model

Aqua Watercraft & Alternative Builds: As I mentioned above in the build section all three models are meant to look like some kind of sea life. The initial build has vibes of a Manta or Sting Ray, the SSS has a definite crab or possibly other shelled crustacean design though not lobster and the ToF looks like an actual fish with a moving tail and everything. All three builds are fairly decent and mostly resemble their digital counterparts. I’m torn on which one I’d like to see on the toy tag permanently, but as I noted above the Trident of Fire is one of the best. The Aqua Watercraft is a fairly close second though. I feel the Seven Seas Speeder is the weakest as it relies on parts that are a tad off for what you’re trying to build.

The Digital Content

Adventure World: Again it’s just another character that opens up the included Starter Set DC Adventure World. I kind of wish they had created unique areas of the Adventure World that could expand it into a larger world with more iconic areas similar to how LEGO Batman 3 had numerous planets to visit opening up more and more hub worlds to visit.

Character & Vehicle Abilities: Aquaman is needed for a specific type of puzzle known on the ability wheel as Atlantis, with it he can communicate with sea creatures at certain pools to summon bricks to build a brick-creature to solve some kind of puzzle in an area where the Atlantis pools are located.

His other abilities are Dive, Hazard Cleaner and Growth. Fairly uncommon abilities. The Aqua Watercraft can Dive and travel on the water, the Seven Seas Speeder has a Special Weapon and can use Speed Boost and the Trident of Fire has a Special Attack and can Destroy LEGO Silver Objects. Overall not much to the abilities, but perfectly serviceable for what they are.

Overall opinion

Aquaman is a must own character to solve Atlantis puzzles. He is the only one who can do this, I believe. All of the builds are fairly nice and the Digital Content isn’t that disappointing for the abilities at least. If you want the entire Justice League you want this set, so I’d recommend it. Highly recommended for folks who want to do everything and solve all the puzzles in-game also. Otherwise it is safe to skip.
